title: Work-term Report
description: A work-term report presenting in detail a technical project, activity, or analysis engaged by the student normally during the preceding work term. The report is evaluated on the basis of written communication skills and technical proficiency in the subject matter as demonstrated by the report.  Work-term reports are required courses for the degree but their grades are not included in the average. However, failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress as indicated in the Examinations and Promotions section of this calendar.  Details regarding the evaluation of the work-term reports can be obtained from the student's program advisor.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 1B Chemical, Civil, Environmental, Geological Management, Mechanical, Mechatronics, Nanotechnology, Software, or Systems Design Engineering. Antireq: WKRPT 101

title: Work-term Report
description: A work-term report presenting in detail a technical project, activity, or analysis engaged by the student normally during the preceding work term. Work-term reports are required courses for the degree but their grades are not included in the average.  However, failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress as indicated in the Examinations and Promotions section of this calendar.  Details regarding the evaluation of the work-term reports can be obtained from the student's program advisor.  [Note:  This course is considered as DRNA]

title: Work-term Report
description:
Students will initiate an on-line record and assessment of their educational and work experience, tracked against two sets of criteria, the Student Performance Criteria established by the Canadian Architectural Certification Board and the Canadian Experience Record used by the provincial licensing bodies. The work-term reports are required courses for the degree but their grades are not included in the average. However, failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress as indicated in the Examinations and Promotions section of this calendar. Details regarding the evaluation of the work-term reports can be obtained from the student's program advisor. 
[Note: This course is considered as DRNA]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 3A Architecture students

title: Work-term Report
description:
Students will complete a case study analysis of the firm in which they are employed. Work-term reports are required courses for the degree but their grades are not included in the average. However, failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress as indicated in the Examinations and Promotions section of this calendar. Details regarding the evaluation of the work-term reports can be obtained from the student's program advisor.
[Note: This course is considered as DRNA]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 3B Architecture students

title: Science Work-Term Report 2
description: Students submit a detailed work-term report based on a technical project, activity or analysis they conducted during their work term. Work-term reports are required courses for the co-op designation. Submitted grades are not included in any averages. Detailed guidelines for work-term reports are posted on the Faculty website. [Note: PD 11 counts as work-term report 1]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: All BSc Honours Co-operative Science Programs

title: Environment Work-term Report 2
description: A reflection exercise through which students document the linkages between their work-term experiences and progress towards achieving their academic, professional and personal goals.  The documentation can be presented in various forms, consistent with the Faculty's guidelines. The report is evaluated on the basis of both the quality of presentation and strength of reflection. Work-term reports are required courses for the degree but their grades are not included in the average. However, failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress as indicated in the Examinations and Promotions section of this calendar. Details regarding the evaluation of the work-term reports can be obtained from the student's program advisor.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: PD12; Level at least 2A, Bachelor of Environmental Studies Co-op

title: Applied Health Sciences Work-term Report 2
description: A work-term report, presenting in detail, a technical or reflective review of a project, activity, or analysis, is normally undertaken by the student during the preceding work term. The report is evaluated on the basis of written communication skills and technical proficiency in the subject matter as demonstrated by the report. Work-term reports are required courses for a co-op designation but their grades are not included in the student's average. Failed work-term report evaluations may delay a student's progress.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: PD 12; Level at least 2A; Applied Health Sciences students only
